result.execSummary:
The defendant JUSTIN T. KAUL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond of $150.00 applied to costs.  Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts immediately after court. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
IMPOSED & STAYED as a condition of probation.

NOTES:  If probation is revoked, 2 days credit shall then be applied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with attached jury instruction

9:14 AM Defendant JUSTIN T. KAUL in court.  Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court for JUSTIN T. KAUL.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  State's offer = plea to count 1, -- 3 yrs probation with imposed & stayed jail as a condition of probation.  Defense argues for 18 months probation.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.  Court finds due to Defendant's compliance with the CHIPS orders, the 18 months is appropriate.
Jury Trial

10:24 AM Defendant JUSTIN T. KAUL in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on May 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.
